title: Edcrypto91
author: Edcrypto91
content: Most recent posts on this forum such as https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5449800.0Seems more like few persons are scared that they may loss to their Bitcoin hodlings due to the recent drops in price of Bitcoin This is very understandable but as a Bitcoin investor you should know that with the series of price changes Bitcoin has encountered over the years we can say that it rises in value more than it drops .Therefore I want to urge all my fellow bitcointalkers to not lose interest in holding because of these little drops in price  keep holding your Bitcoin .It will definitely boom soon

This scenario already happened in the past many times and it’s a normal process to remove those weak hands to make the community pure strong holder. There’s always someone willing to takeover for those who are scared so let them be. Real bitcoin enthusiast don’t see the price of Bitcoin with current value. You will understand this if you watch many times how scared people react on every price drop.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: When someone hold Bitcoin they may lose some money if the price of BTC will decrease instead of losing their Bitcoin holdings. When the price decrease then the value of their BTC will change but the amount of BTC that a holder have won't change at all. You are giving them the wrong information that they will lose the BTC that they areholding if the price decrease. As you can see, my explanation is what will really happen when some hold BTC and what will happen when price change.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: As of when Bitcoin price got to $20k this year, it increased $30k which is about 50% increase between February to this month. So now that the price has reduced by just about 8%, those that still bought in the range of $16k to $25k are not at a loss yet, and even the 8% drop in price is not enough to panic, unless for newbie investors. This is not the time to panic and sell off; the drop in price is even a better opportunity to buy more. Let us not forget that in 2011 Bitcoin fell by -99%.

comments.body: Yeah, good advice. You can't lose Bitcoin if you just hold it. comments.body: Quote from: Edcrypto91 on April 22, 2023, 09:20:17 PMMost recent posts on this forum such as https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5449800.0Seems more like few persons are scared that they may loss to their Bitcoin hodlings due to the recent drops in price of Bitcoin This is very understandable but as a Bitcoin investor you should know that with the series of price changes Bitcoin has encountered over the years we can say that it rises in value more than it drops .Therefore I want to urge all my fellow bitcointalkers to not lose interest in holding because of these little drops in price  keep holding your Bitcoin .It will definitely boom soonWhen I see that kind of threads I actually think that the OP is not scared at all, instead he's trying to scare the others. I mean let's be serious and analyze the situation: bitcoin a just ~10 years ago was worth a few dollars, now it's worth almost $28k (~$27,600 while I'm writing), how could be someone worried? Also the whole ecosystem keeps growing, government are not as anti-bitcoin as they used to be, more and more people own and use bitcoin, several big corporations own it. Just use a little brain and you know why it's pointless worrying about today's price.

comments.body: there is nothing to be scared of if you risk the amount that you can afford to lose. investing into crypto isn't like any other investments out there in which you are laxed since anytime you can lose any amount and also you need to monitor the prices for the sake of sleeping every night soundly. investment here is close to gambling than investing so you must be prepared at what will comes next.

comments.author: Dzwaafu11
comments.body: Real investors are not afraid of how bitcoin investment goes down, because we all know that this is not how the bitcoin market has been in the past years; it usually goes down and then goes up. Furthermore, before you invest, I believe you should read the rules and regulations guiding the Bitcoin investment and other cryptocurrencies that there is risk behind it, which means you believe in the risk and are willing to accept whatever it is. Real investors keep these in mind since they understand how the market works.So, what are you afraid of? Though it is difficult to watch your money fall and know that you may lose it, I feel that this type of fear should be reserved for those who are new to bitcoin investing.
